results.title: Wheels and axles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Simple Machines”.
Illustrates the force and distance relationships which exist in machines, utilizing the principles of the wheel and exle. The way in which the working wheels of a bicycle increase force or distance is analysed and visually demonstrated, and the film examines such applications of the wheel and axle as the gear drive, belt drive and crank.

results.title: Wheels across the Himalaya
results.brief_description: In March 1981, Elisabeth Hastings, suffering from polio, and Rheinhardt Raftl, a victim of multiple sclerosis, became the first disabled people to trek across Nepal. The film shows them riding mountain ponies, through the Himalayas, travelling in rafts down one of the most violent rivers in the world, and clinging to the backs of elephants in the Chitwan jungle.

results.title: Wheel on the chimney
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Freitag, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: The charm of the European countryside is portrayed by sweeping pictures and rhythmic words in this tale of two storks who raise their young in Hungary and then fly south to spend the winter. From the book of the same title by Margaret Wise Brown and Tibor Gergely and narrated by John Cunningham.

results.title: Wheel of prosperity
results.creator_credit: P.R.S. Pillay, Jehangir Bhownagary and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: Spinning and weaving was part of the ancient heritage in India and many villagers earned their living by making textiles. When machine-made materials were imported these villages were thrown out of work and many starved. Ghandi recognised that the revival of cottage industries was essential for prosperity and through his influence the home woven textiles again became popular. The growing of cotton, spinning, carding and weaving and the marking of very simple machines to carry out these processes are shown in the film. The spinning wheel has been adopted as the symbol of prosperity for India.
results.creator_credit_for_label: P.R.S. Pillay, Jehangir Bhownagary and Documentary Films of India

results.title: Wheel is turning in Nepal
results.brief_description: Traditional culture and beginnings of technological change in Nepal. Shows the lifestyle and threatened crafts of Nepal including an introduction to Nepalese/Tibetan/Indian cooking, flour milling, and rice winnowing, wood turning, and pottery, the use of natural resources such as water to power the wood turning lathes and indicates the effects of tourism and increased trade on the native craftsmen.

results.title: Wheat in Australia
results.brief_description: An instructional film that surveys the wheat industry in Australia: how wheat is grown, and how it is distributed within overseas and domestic markets; geographical areas of wheat growing; varieties; rust and the work of the Farrer; rotationand fertilization; ploughing, harrowing and sowing; hravesting and how a header works; bulk handling, testing and determination of FAQ; and the delivery to ships in ports or to flour mills. Commentary by Roger Climpson.

results.title: Wheat country
results.creator_credit: Roger Blais, Tim Wilson and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Here is a film showing how each spring, prairie farmers renew their gamble with wind, frost, drought, rust and hail to begin again the cycle that may bring a good, or a lean, year. This story of big-scale wheat farming is told by a farm woman whose sons represent the fourth generation to operate a Saskatchewan farm.

results.title: Wheat
results.creator_credit: Robert Nichol, Douglas Jackson and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: In this epic of the autumn harvest on the Canadian prairies, there is artistry in what the film shows of the seas of golden grain and the bold geometry carved on them by the invading fleet of combine harvesters. Canadian Northern is still the wheat of top quality. This film shows some of the men who grow it, as well as those who keep it moving to world markets.

results.title: Whazzat?
results.creator_credit: Art Pierson, Todd Delerman and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents an adaptation of the East Indian folktale about six blind men who come upon an elephant and attempt to describe it. When each meets and touches the elephant he thinks he has encountered something different. Stresses the moral that cooperating with others can achieve more than working alone. For primary grades.

results.title: Whatever Happened to the Murray River?
results.brief_description: The film traces the history of the exploitation of the Murray River and shows the environmental consequences.
